IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To cultivate the science of jurisprudence promote reforms in the law, facilitate the administration of justice, elevate the standard of integrity, honor and courtesy in the legal profession, and develop the spirit of fellowship amongst the members.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To cultivate the science of jurisprudence promote reforms in the law, facilitate the administration of justice, elevate the standard of integrity, honor and courtesy in the legal profession, and develop the spirit of fellowship amongst the members.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Association's Forms 990, Return of Organization Exempt from Income Tax, and Forms 990-T, Exempt Organization Business Income Tax Returns, for the years ending May 31, 2023, 2022, 2021 and 2020 are subject to examination by the IRS, generally for 3 years after they were filed. The Association has concluded that there are no material uncertain tax liabilities to be recognized at this time.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The form 990 is presented to the board members and governing body during the board meeting. The return will be reviewed and approved by the board members and governing body before the return can be filed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The conflict of interest will be reviewed and approved by the board members on an annual basis.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The governing documents, policies, and financial statements are available upon request.
